subject: XenAPI: Don't assume specific network interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 11:59:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-xenserver'], 'message': "XenAPI: Don't assume specific network interfaces

The default for GUEST_INTERFACE_DEFAULT now uses the ip command
to find an interface; so it will work on multiple distributions.

XenAPI should not be setting a specific interface here, as it will
almost always be wrong.  In most cases, the calculated value for
GUEST_INTERFACE_DEFAULT will be a better default.

PUBLIC_INTERFACE_DEFAULT makes even less sense as it's often an
internal bridge for devstack scenarios.

In both cases, the right way to override these is to set
GUEST_INTERFACE / PUBLIC_INTERFACE in the localrc rather than
changing the _DEFAULT values.

Change-Id: I0cf84438d778bf1a2481328165513c59167490e2
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Don't assume specific network interfaces

The default for GUEST_INTERFACE_DEFAULT now uses the ip command
to find an interface; so it will work on multiple distributions.

XenAPI should not be setting a specific interface here, as it will
almost always be wrong.  In most cases, the calculated value for
GUEST_INTERFACE_DEFAULT will be a better default.

PUBLIC_INTERFACE_DEFAULT makes even less sense as it's often an
internal bridge for devstack scenarios.

In both cases, the right way to override these is to set
GUEST_INTERFACE / PUBLIC_INTERFACE in the localrc rather than
changing the _DEFAULT values.

Change-Id: I0cf84438d778bf1a2481328165513c59167490e2

subject: neutron: Wait until ovs-vswitchd creates the bridge
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16803, 'name': 'liujunpeng', 'email': 'liujunpeng@inspur.com', 'username': 'liujunpeng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 12:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base'], 'message': "neutron: Wait until ovs-vswitchd creates the bridge

Seeing a race condition where lib/neutron code tries to
set the MTU on br-ex before it exists.

Thanks to some good grepping by sdague, it appears that the difference
between lib/neutron and lib/neutron-legacy is that the initial bridge
being created is br-int while in lib/neutron the initial bridge
created is br-ex, which means there must be some kind of warm-up that
occurs between the first bridge that is created by ovs-vswitchd and the
second, and the second one created is much faster.

So instead, let's just wait for the bridge to be created successfully.

Change-Id: I271dc8b6ae5487c80d2a22153b3fc45fb247707f"}]
commit_message:
neutron: Wait until ovs-vswitchd creates the bridge

Seeing a race condition where lib/neutron code tries to
set the MTU on br-ex before it exists.

Thanks to some good grepping by sdague, it appears that the difference
between lib/neutron and lib/neutron-legacy is that the initial bridge
being created is br-int while in lib/neutron the initial bridge
created is br-ex, which means there must be some kind of warm-up that
occurs between the first bridge that is created by ovs-vswitchd and the
second, and the second one created is much faster.

So instead, let's just wait for the bridge to be created successfully.

Change-Id: I271dc8b6ae5487c80d2a22153b3fc45fb247707f

commit_message:
Add Windows SMBFS connector

This patch adds a Windows SMBFS connector. Also, a Windows
RemoteFS class is added, being used by this connector, having
a similar interface with the Linux RemoteFS client class.

The patch using Windows os-brick connectors in the Hyper-V
Nova driver: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273504/

The Windows connector factory function has been removed as it's not
needed anymore.

Change-Id: I0c753a667d58391da7a903d11ab1f4729e68461a
Implements: blueprint os-brick-windows-support

commit_message:
Move *Flavor parameters into per-role templates

We have some inconsistent naming here, but move them with their
current names for backwards compatibility, we can address the
deprecation of the inconsistent names at a future time.

This is required to enable jinja templating of roles in overcloud.yaml

Change-Id: I2ea673d9bc52967f9b7c25555059b964abf66966
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Change cleanup to destroy as cleanup is a misnomer

The cleanup command in the external API is a misnomer and should
be called destroy.

Change-Id: I083e80699e09bb24266ce1bf549772a5de92a49e
Closes-Bug: 1610364

Allocate PCI devices on migration

Enable the resource tracker to allocate PCI devices on migration.  The
resource tracker which correspond to the destination node in the migration
object is responsible to allocate the PCI devices.

subject: [Tempest] Fix concurrency in "test_show_share_server" test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 17:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_share_servers.py'], 'message': '[Tempest] Fix concurrency in "test_show_share_server" test

In test "test_show_share_server" that is located in
"manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_share_servers.py" module
we can (rarely) face concurrency issue, when first share_server from
list of share servers gets deleted between "taking list of servers" call and
"getting its first element". It can be any share server of any concurrent test.
So, fix it by usage of share server that is being hold by its class and will
always exist while this test runs.

Change-Id: I7675a201bcd1eb33f1214ba9837f28a5295f54fc
Closes-Bug: #1608600
'}]
commit_message:
[Tempest] Fix concurrency in "test_show_share_server" test

In test "test_show_share_server" that is located in
"manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_share_servers.py" module
we can (rarely) face concurrency issue, when first share_server from
list of share servers gets deleted between "taking list of servers" call and
"getting its first element". It can be any share server of any concurrent test.
So, fix it by usage of share server that is being hold by its class and will
always exist while this test runs.

Change-Id: I7675a201bcd1eb33f1214ba9837f28a5295f54fc
Closes-Bug: #1608600

"}]
commit_message:
Bump to use min of glance_store 0.16.0

In the 0.16.0 version of glance_store we've removed the s3 backend
store driver. We've spent a few days in the gate testing with versions
of glance_store above 0.13.0 with appropriate transitive dependencies.

Glance would like to release Newton with deterministic upgrade of 'not'
to expect the s3 driver in the source tree. That's possible only when
glance uses minimum of store 0.16.0. Once that happens, glance source
tree docs will need to be added to indicate the same and a few other
changes need to be done in glance tree to indicate the same.

For more context, please see a proposed review
I680ee2baf39b49156d173e2ae108ae5d0221eca7

Change-Id: I5d2da0611365b838f41285b64cdcfef9adf50e85

commit_message:
Started refactoring helpers to use SSHManager

This is a first commit in series, that should
eventually refactor whole fuel-qa to use SSHManager class
for SSH access.

This commit addresses the usage of "get remote"-style
expressions in helper modules. However, due to a large scope
even in helpers alone, it doesn't fixes all the places
where SSHManager should be used.

Change-Id: I527efaef0874d8eb80b7f93b32ea52224a746593
Co-Authored-By: Omar Rivera <gr113x@att.com>
Partial-Bug: #1566377
Partial-Bug: #1580324

commit_message:
Restricted Magnum service state to 'up' and 'down'

Magnum service state could have any string having length 1-255.
This patch restricts value to be one of the following
  - up
  - down

Change-Id: I740e0379b78c08cbd9ded7ca7bd1bbdd92d44e90
Closes-bug: #1609216

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-06 16:22:52.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/entry_points', 'devstack/override-defaults', 'devstack/odl-releases/common', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/README.rst'], 'message': 'devstack: refactor ODL_L3 logic depending on used feature

External bridge behavior was changed in ODL in the new netvirt.
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/41925

The external interface provided by provider_mappings will be added
to br-int by default, so there will not be an additional bridge.

In addition, ODL is the one creating the bridge and adding the port
to it, there is no reason for a manual fallback of adding the
interface into the bridge.

provider_mappings does not imply the bridge name - only the link
between the physical network (e.g physnet1) and the port name
to be added to the bridge.

Change-Id: Ic45059d672dbb4058ddef90004ef3cef69936d95
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: refactor ODL_L3 logic depending on used feature

External bridge behavior was changed in ODL in the new netvirt.
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/41925

The external interface provided by provider_mappings will be added
to br-int by default, so there will not be an additional bridge.

In addition, ODL is the one creating the bridge and adding the port
to it, there is no reason for a manual fallback of adding the
interface into the bridge.

provider_mappings does not imply the bridge name - only the link
between the physical network (e.g physnet1) and the port name
to be added to the bridge.

Change-Id: Ic45059d672dbb4058ddef90004ef3cef69936d95

subject: Add empty string for wait_for_active_bridge
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 333, 'name': 'Isaku Yamahata', 'email': 'isaku.yamahata@gmail.com', 'username': 'yamahata'}, {'_account_id': 10386, 'name': 'OpenDaylight CI', 'email': 'odl-openstack@opendaylight.org', 'username': 'odl-jenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11114, 'name': 'yalei wang', 'email': 'yalei.wang@intel.com', 'username': 'yalie'}, {'_account_id': 11240, 'name': 'Sam Hague', 'email': 'shague@gmail.com', 'username': 'shague'}, {'_account_id': 11952, 'name': 'Flavio Fernandes', 'email': 'flavio@flaviof.com', 'username': 'ffernand'}, {'_account_id': 18429, 'name': 'Vishal Thapar', 'email': 'vthapar@redhat.com', 'username': 'thapar'}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-17 17:25:14.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings.odl', 'devstack/entry_points', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Add empty string for wait_for_active_bridge

Depending on configuration, br-int(OVS_BR) may not be created. In that
case devstack fails with timeout of wait_for_active_bridge.
With this patch, when OVS_BR is specifed to "", devstack won't create
the bridge and wait for it. In order to use default value, the value
should be unset.
This allows one to disable waiting for bridge creation
without impacting existing functionality and test cases.
NOTE: user should be careful about the difference between
OVS_BR="" and unset OVS_BR.

Closes-Bug: #1518428
Change-Id: I283f09259f82fe681cf0c775e5d9596316c86ca6
Co-Authored-By: Vishal Thapar <vishal.thapar@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata<isaku.yamahata@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add empty string for wait_for_active_bridge

Depending on configuration, br-int(OVS_BR) may not be created. In that
case devstack fails with timeout of wait_for_active_bridge.
With this patch, when OVS_BR is specifed to "", devstack won't create
the bridge and wait for it. In order to use default value, the value
should be unset.
This allows one to disable waiting for bridge creation
without impacting existing functionality and test cases.
NOTE: user should be careful about the difference between
OVS_BR="" and unset OVS_BR.

Closes-Bug: #1518428
Change-Id: I283f09259f82fe681cf0c775e5d9596316c86ca6
Co-Authored-By: Vishal Thapar <vishal.thapar@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata<isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6802, 'name': 'Joel Coffman', 'email': 'jmc7tp@gmail.com', 'username': 'joel-coffman'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 9459, 'name': '.Haifeng Yan', 'email': 'yanheven@qq.com', 'username': 'yan'}, {'_account_id': 11279, 'name': 'Angus Lees', 'email': 'gus@inodes.org', 'username': 'gus'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 23:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_rootwrap/tests/test_rootwrap.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/wrapper.py'], 'message': "always allow privsep-helper as a command

To support the seamless transition from oslo.rootwrap to oslo.privsep
across multiple projects: nova, neutron, cinder, and libraries os-vif,
os-brick we need to be able to execute privsep-helper as root from
rootwrap.

Rootwrap's use of etc (by default) for rules makes the upgrade path
very manual for operators. Given that every project is going to add
the same privsep-helper rule at some point over the next few cycles,
instead of making every project have to have a manual update process,
we just whitelist privsep-helper. This will immediately make it
available for all, and upgrades become far more seamless.

Change-Id: If8b60f2d671b9d12c58226019d787917efaedd9c
"}]
commit_message:
always allow privsep-helper as a command

To support the seamless transition from oslo.rootwrap to oslo.privsep
across multiple projects: nova, neutron, cinder, and libraries os-vif,
os-brick we need to be able to execute privsep-helper as root from
rootwrap.

Rootwrap's use of etc (by default) for rules makes the upgrade path
very manual for operators. Given that every project is going to add
the same privsep-helper rule at some point over the next few cycles,
instead of making every project have to have a manual update process,
we just whitelist privsep-helper. This will immediately make it
available for all, and upgrades become far more seamless.

Change-Id: If8b60f2d671b9d12c58226019d787917efaedd9c

commit_message:
Fix issue with reprepro-import distribution

Now that it is possible to run reprepro-import against different
repos, we need to properly build up our distribution for reprepro. Now
we we'll use jessie-newton or jessie-newton-backports depending on the
job.

Change-Id: I1e5d0ba03bceedebf27ed4b4a76ac0f6bfa588ce
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-07 14:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/package-state-505f9772bb0d668e.yaml', 'tasks/install_binary.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I7ddc32b286071b29c197b18370cf49af235527fa
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I7ddc32b286071b29c197b18370cf49af235527fa

Now with the latest keystoneauth version, if the qps is a little bit
high, then Zaqar will always fail to get token with a connection

Change-Id: Ica114195a57c9128d132b434ba0984d5e16bdd92

commit_message:
Fix Rally job

Now with the latest keystoneauth version, if the qps is a little bit
high, then Zaqar will always fail to get token with a connection
failure. So this patch just reduce the qps from 50 to 20 to mitigate
the issue.

Change-Id: Ica114195a57c9128d132b434ba0984d5e16bdd92

commit_message:
Enable getting connection info for MKS consoles

The current API allows getting connection info only for tokens which
correspond to RDP consoles. We need this API to also work for MKS tokens
in order to implement a standalone MKS proxy.

Closes-Bug: #1485529
Change-Id: Ifa11ac39f4a6698527c9c734d2dbfcc501f1c7a0

subject: Added support for template variables
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-08 18:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/multi-node.rst', 'kolla_kubernetes/kube_service_status.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/service_resources.py', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml', 'services/mariadb/mariadb-pv.yml.j2', 'kolla_kubernetes/commands/cmd_resource.py', 'services/mariadb/mariadb-disk.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Added support for template variables

- These changes necessary to enable template re-use.  Enables the
  specification of additional variables to be passed to each template
  referenced in ./etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml
- Template.vars are additional vars in the form of a dict passed to
  the jinja templating engine. Templates may access this dict with
  "kolla_kubernetes.template.vars.<subkey>".  This enables arguments
  to be passed to templates so that they may be re-used or configured.
  These template.vars may not contain any other nested jinja
  references, and are passed unmodified directly to the template.
- Used mariadb templates as an example for template.vars
- Changes to ./etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml
    resources:
      disk:
      - name: mariadb-disk <-- Name is new
        template: services/mariadb/mariadb-disk.sh.j2  <-- New
        vars:             <-- Template variables are new
          size_in_gb: 10  <-- Template var example
- CLI Syntax Change: Resource templates are specified by name (defined
  in service_resources.yml) instead of path.  This is necessary
  because the same template may be referenced multiple times in
  service_resources.yml (with different template args), and a name is
  necessary to distinguish between the different
  template/template_args combinations.
  FROM: kolla-kubernetes resource-template \
          <action> <resource_type> <service> <TEMPLATE-FILE>
  TO:   kolla-kubernetes resource-template \
          <action> <service> <resource_type> <RESOURCE-NAME>
- CLI Syntax Change: Ordering changed to match resource-template
  FROM: kolla-kubernetes resource <action> <resource_type> <service>
  TO:   kolla-kubernetes resource <action> <service> <resource_type>

Change-Id: Ie1e0c973206a239bc3759827149b4e8d67029752
Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-cli
'}]
commit_message:
Added support for template variables

- These changes necessary to enable template re-use.  Enables the
  specification of additional variables to be passed to each template
  referenced in ./etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml
- Template.vars are additional vars in the form of a dict passed to
  the jinja templating engine. Templates may access this dict with
  "kolla_kubernetes.template.vars.<subkey>".  This enables arguments
  to be passed to templates so that they may be re-used or configured.
  These template.vars may not contain any other nested jinja
  references, and are passed unmodified directly to the template.
- Used mariadb templates as an example for template.vars
- Changes to ./etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml
    resources:
      disk:
      - name: mariadb-disk <-- Name is new
        template: services/mariadb/mariadb-disk.sh.j2  <-- New
        vars:             <-- Template variables are new
          size_in_gb: 10  <-- Template var example
- CLI Syntax Change: Resource templates are specified by name (defined
  in service_resources.yml) instead of path.  This is necessary
  because the same template may be referenced multiple times in
  service_resources.yml (with different template args), and a name is
  necessary to distinguish between the different
  template/template_args combinations.
  FROM: kolla-kubernetes resource-template \
          <action> <resource_type> <service> <TEMPLATE-FILE>
  TO:   kolla-kubernetes resource-template \
          <action> <service> <resource_type> <RESOURCE-NAME>
- CLI Syntax Change: Ordering changed to match resource-template
  FROM: kolla-kubernetes resource <action> <resource_type> <service>
  TO:   kolla-kubernetes resource <action> <service> <resource_type>

Change-Id: Ie1e0c973206a239bc3759827149b4e8d67029752
Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-cli

subject: Add testenv:venv to tox.ini

commit_message:
Convert ceph_pools into a hash type

By using create_resources we can create ceph::pool resources from
a hash. This will make it possible to define custom attributes
for the single pool from the heat templates.

Change-Id: I38978f0f3119e4ab7dd45021e598253cb066cb5a

subject: De-vendorify d3 and nvd3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-05 17:02:00.000000000', 'files': ['app/index.html', 'app/vendor-js/1-d3.js', 'package.json', 'app/vendor-js/2-nvd3.js'], 'message': "De-vendorify d3 and nvd3

It's been almost a year since we started openstack-health, and most of
the bugs and/or missing features from nvd3 have been addressed. This
commit moves us onto the nvd3 releases and packages instead of using
a random git snapshot from Oct. 2015.

Change-Id: Ibfefe310fbad1d80f4c7ec96bda083d97a09824e
"}]
commit_message:
De-vendorify d3 and nvd3

It's been almost a year since we started openstack-health, and most of
the bugs and/or missing features from nvd3 have been addressed. This
commit moves us onto the nvd3 releases and packages instead of using
a random git snapshot from Oct. 2015.

Change-Id: Ibfefe310fbad1d80f4c7ec96bda083d97a09824e

Since it is possible for reprepro-import to download more then 1

commit_message:
Update reprepro-import build to support multiple files

Since it is possible for reprepro-import to download more then 1
.changes file, we now iterate over all files running the include
command.

Change-Id: Ide51533bc7c238ea2b387c1c021999480ed8dc4c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Register Nova with Keystone

This creates the service, endpoints, user project, and role
for Nova within Keystone.

Hat tip to Serguei Bezverkhi because I ended up having to figure
out why Nova's bootstrap was failing by comparing it against
346215. :)

Current config file:
api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

storage_provider: "host"
orchestration_engine: "KUBERNETES"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

rabbitmq_servers: "rabbitmq"
enable_rabbitmq_cluster: "no"

nova_database_address: "mariadb"
nova_api_database_address: "mariadb"

nova_admin_endpoint: "http://nova-api:{{ nova_api_port }}/v2/%(tenant_id)s"
nova_internal_endpoint: "http://nova-api:{{ nova_api_port }}/v2/%(tenant_id)s"
nova_public_endpoint: "http://nova-api:{{ nova_api_port }}/v2/%(tenant_id)s"
project_name: "nova"

openstack_nova_auth: "{'auth_url':'{{ keystone_admin_url }}','username':'{{ openstack_auth.username }}','password':'{{ openstack_auth.password }}','project_name':'{{ openstack_auth.project_name }}','domain_name':'default'}"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"

keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"

neutron_database_address: "mariadb"
neutron_host: "neutron"

glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"
glance_database_address: "mariadb"

Change-Id: I3529454a08cab6957da1e96cef1e0f28d7a9ce02
Partially-implements: blueprint remove-net-host
Partially-implements: blueprint replication-controllers
Partially-implements: blueprint nova-kubernetes

commit_message:
Fix Nova bootstrap

The existing bootstrap wasn't creating the databases in MariaDB
nor the users nor the permissions.

Some of the containers didn't need to be run as part of bootstrap.

Turned off hostnetworking.

Nova doesn't quite run properly, but it does bootstrap now.

Current config file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"
rabbitmq_servers: "rabbitmq"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
neutron_database_address: "mariadb"
nova_database_address: "mariadb"
nova_api_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"
neutron_host: "neutron"
glance_database_address: "mariadb"
enable_rabbitmq_cluster: "no"

storage_provider: "host"

Change-Id: I597e31988a21e0eacac4764a03672c15a3d7de4c
Partially-implements: blueprint remove-net-host
Partially-implements: blueprint replication-controllers
Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services
Partially-implements: blueprint nova-kubernetes

command.

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-08 14:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/ceph-base.yaml', 'puppet/services/ceph-mon.yaml'], 'message': "Support arbitrary attributes for the Ceph pools

This change adds a CephPools parameter which can be used to
provide custom settings for any Ceph pool.

It also removes our custom setting for the default pg_num,
pgp_num and size so that these are used for the managed
pools (and can be overridden) but aren't enforced globally.

Change-Id: Idcf28bec46beabb1b590fc8e78b43e58d8e35717
Closes-Bug: 1517969
Depends-On: I38978f0f3119e4ab7dd45021e598253cb066cb5a
"}]
commit_message:
Support arbitrary attributes for the Ceph pools

This change adds a CephPools parameter which can be used to
provide custom settings for any Ceph pool.

It also removes our custom setting for the default pg_num,
pgp_num and size so that these are used for the managed
pools (and can be overridden) but aren't enforced globally.

Change-Id: Idcf28bec46beabb1b590fc8e78b43e58d8e35717
Closes-Bug: 1517969
Depends-On: I38978f0f3119e4ab7dd45021e598253cb066cb5a

commit_message:
Simplify host_uuid and gets

This change set reduces the number of host_uuids being passed around in
networking-powervm.  It also switches many of the calls from the very
verbose adapter.read() format to the wrapper get method.

Change-Id: If6f56d14f4161ea238d490ea44ecd74e4f468e8f
Closes-Bug: #1607338

subject: Allow Neutron services to specify config path
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-08 16:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/service-conf-path-b27cab31dbc72ad4.yaml', 'tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow Neutron services to specify config path

An example is I80546b6deefe0878398716d173b7dcc36c3bef3a where the
configuration needs to be dropped to /etc/calico.

By adapting this task we can allow services to deploy configs
to arbitrary paths instead of a statically set /etc/neutron.

Change-Id: I8c4c7f513074fbd154ab253182b83227628d44ef
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Neutron services to specify config path

An example is I80546b6deefe0878398716d173b7dcc36c3bef3a where the
configuration needs to be dropped to /etc/calico.

By adapting this task we can allow services to deploy configs
to arbitrary paths instead of a statically set /etc/neutron.

Change-Id: I8c4c7f513074fbd154ab253182b83227628d44ef

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-08 13:32:26.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Implement TripleO centos-7-nonha-multinode-updates

We decided to decouple updates from upgrades testing.
Updates will be testing update from last commit, while upgrades will
test from previous stable release to current.

This patch adds an experimental job to test overcloud updates and rename
centos-7-ovb-upgrades to be centos-7-ovb-updates, since
centos-7-ovb-upgrades was doing updates (previous commit to trunk).

Change-Id: Icb9b5f403346b747c38ac33f3879cdcbf89c97ac
'}]
commit_message:
Implement TripleO centos-7-nonha-multinode-updates

We decided to decouple updates from upgrades testing.
Updates will be testing update from last commit, while upgrades will
test from previous stable release to current.

This patch adds an experimental job to test overcloud updates and rename
centos-7-ovb-upgrades to be centos-7-ovb-updates, since
centos-7-ovb-upgrades was doing updates (previous commit to trunk).

Change-Id: Icb9b5f403346b747c38ac33f3879cdcbf89c97ac

subject: Handle xenial/trusty and -nv jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 17:34:44.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Handle xenial/trusty and -nv jobs

A job names X-ubuntu-xenial-nv should be run only on master - like the
X-ubuntu-xenial ones. Enhance regexes for trusty and xenial to handle an
optional -nv after them.

Change-Id: Id8482a9a1f311f220d43709fec235a5c9d8de3be
'}]
commit_message:
Handle xenial/trusty and -nv jobs

A job names X-ubuntu-xenial-nv should be run only on master - like the
X-ubuntu-xenial ones. Enhance regexes for trusty and xenial to handle an
optional -nv after them.

Change-Id: Id8482a9a1f311f220d43709fec235a5c9d8de3be

subject: Make deployed-server OS::Neutron::Port optional
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-07 11:29:13.000000000', 'files': ['environments/deployed-server-environment.yaml', 'environments/deployed-server-noop-ctlplane.yaml', 'deployed-server/ctlplane-port.yaml', 'deployed-server/deployed-server.yaml'], 'message': 'Make deployed-server OS::Neutron::Port optional

This patch makes it possible to set
OS::TripleO::DeployedServer::ControlPlanePort: OS::Heat::None
in your resource_registry and thereby avoid the creation of
a neutron port for the deployed server. This is useful if
you are bootstrapping things in an environment without
Neutron.

Also, includes a new deployed-server-noop-ctlplane.yaml
environment file.

Change-Id: I2990dc816698e0f6e3193a8fc7c9c6767c6e50e5
'}]
commit_message:
Make deployed-server OS::Neutron::Port optional

This patch makes it possible to set
OS::TripleO::DeployedServer::ControlPlanePort: OS::Heat::None
in your resource_registry and thereby avoid the creation of
a neutron port for the deployed server. This is useful if
you are bootstrapping things in an environment without
Neutron.

Also, includes a new deployed-server-noop-ctlplane.yaml
environment file.

Change-Id: I2990dc816698e0f6e3193a8fc7c9c6767c6e50e5

subject: LBaaS dashboard resepects OPENSTACK_SSL settings
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-04 15:02:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas_dashboard/api/rest/barbican.py'], 'message': "LBaaS dashboard resepects OPENSTACK_SSL settings

Currently when creating a session, the LBaaS dashboard API doesn't respect
OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY and OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT.  This patch directly
addresses that by checking those values, then applying the appropriate logic
for passing into the 'verify' parameter when creating a Session.

Change-Id: Ie452b32353e1430127994644725723ec917602d0
Closes-Bug: 1609843"}]
commit_message:
LBaaS dashboard resepects OPENSTACK_SSL settings

Currently when creating a session, the LBaaS dashboard API doesn't respect
OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY and OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT.  This patch directly
addresses that by checking those values, then applying the appropriate logic
for passing into the 'verify' parameter when creating a Session.

Change-Id: Ie452b32353e1430127994644725723ec917602d0
Closes-Bug: 1609843

commit_message:
Remove unneeded --branch from zuul-cloner

zuul-cloner has been updated, we do not need to pass --branch argument
for the normal zuul-cloner builders zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints and
zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints-cross.

Change-Id: I788ec0183f31f7524b4f5220c214a175b3eb1ecc

commit_message:
HNAS drivers refactoring

HNAS NFS and iSCSI drivers need a refactoring in order to make
the codes more readable and easier to maintain.
This patch is refactoring the HNAS drivers codes, deprecating
the old paths and increasing the unit tests coverage.

Co-Authored-By: Alyson Rosa <alyson.rodrigues.rosa@gmail.com>
Also-By: Erlon Cruz <sombrafam@gmail.com>

DocImpact
Change-Id: I1b5d5155306c39c528af4037a5f54cf3d4dc1ffa

commit_message:
Enable constraints for releasenotes

Testing of releasenotes publishing looks fine with the test job, remove
the test job and enable zuul-cloner for the releasenotes jobs.

Since releasenotes are always published from master, run the publish
jobs as well as the check/gate jobs on xenial.

Change-Id: If5d6b11bd795091eef949001cca6e8d4ec723ef2

commit_message:
Replace assertDictEqual

Here,assertDictEqual is test that two dictionaries are equal.This method
will be used by default to compare dictionaries in calls to assertEqual.
So,I replace assertDictEqual.

refer to [1] for more information

[1]:https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.assertDictEqual

commit_message:
Implement the Last Function

The Alarm state is driven by the last measurement with the newest
timestamp. Use the value even if the measurement is older than the
oldest bucket. This ensures the measurement will be used when the
Threshold Engine is started if the measurement
is received while the Threshold Engine is stopped

Never evaluate subAlarm with function Last except on receiving of
a measurement.

Add tests to ensure this works.

The change is dependent on the monasca-common change and the
change to monasca-api to add the state field to sub_alarm.

Change-Id: Ib5123ed035018757a50d9ebeb7335fbca48054f2
Implements: Blueprint last-value

subject: BGP: exclude legacy fip in DVR fip host routes query
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-08 08:12:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_dynamic_routing/db/bgp_db.py', 'neutron_dynamic_routing/tests/unit/db/test_bgp_db.py'], 'message': "BGP: exclude legacy fip in DVR fip host routes query

When query a bgpspeaker's routes, the DVR fip host routes query
will get the routes including the central fip routes. This will
let the central fip has more than one next_hop routes.

This patch adds a RouterExtraAttributes check for the distributed
routers during the DVR fip host routes query.

Change-Id: Idb237d4563236c24c19abd8234cfdec4f2373eee
Closes-Bug: #1608406
"}]
commit_message:
BGP: exclude legacy fip in DVR fip host routes query

When query a bgpspeaker's routes, the DVR fip host routes query
will get the routes including the central fip routes. This will
let the central fip has more than one next_hop routes.

This patch adds a RouterExtraAttributes check for the distributed
routers during the DVR fip host routes query.

Change-Id: Idb237d4563236c24c19abd8234cfdec4f2373eee
Closes-Bug: #1608406

commit_message:
Add a hacking rule to enforce use of LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated.
LOG.warning should be used instead of LOG.warn.
So add the following hacking rule.

- [M331] LOG.warn is deprecated. Enforce use of LOG.warning.

Change-Id: I1f99331e2a51f8295eac0734aa653b4ff04ccf65
Closes-Bug: #1508442

subject: Add a hacking rule for string interpolation at logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 05:48:26.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'masakari/hacking/checks.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Add a hacking rule for string interpolation at logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.
So add a hacking rule for it.

See the oslo i18n guideline.

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: Ib7d97e6edbb8069c12b22505c0d6653b4a17ec78
Closes-Bug: #1596829
'}]
commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for string interpolation at logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.
So add a hacking rule for it.

See the oslo i18n guideline.

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: Ib7d97e6edbb8069c12b22505c0d6653b4a17ec78
Closes-Bug: #1596829

subject: Properly direct MTU parameters and allow service defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-08 14:03:10.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'overcloud.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Properly direct MTU parameters and allow service defaults

This patch wires NeutronTenantMtu to path_mtu instead of the deprecated
network_device_mtu. This maintains similar behavior but allows
global_physnet_mtu to be set independently. The default for this
parameter has also been changed to an empty string, allowing proper
service defaults that enable Neutron's MTU logic to be used.

This patch also sets the default for NeutronDnsmasqOptions to an empty
string and introduces handling of empty values when creating the dnsmasq
configuration file.

Note that is a Mitaka only patch. The properties were completely removed
in Newton in change I540ba5dc69d0506f71b59746efcce94c73f9317f.

Closes-Bug: 1590100
Closes-Bug: 1590101

Change-Id: I6d12a2b741b4a81bf60f47fd553b7f71cd25b1c1
"}]
commit_message:
Properly direct MTU parameters and allow service defaults

This patch wires NeutronTenantMtu to path_mtu instead of the deprecated
network_device_mtu. This maintains similar behavior but allows
global_physnet_mtu to be set independently. The default for this
parameter has also been changed to an empty string, allowing proper
service defaults that enable Neutron's MTU logic to be used.

This patch also sets the default for NeutronDnsmasqOptions to an empty
string and introduces handling of empty values when creating the dnsmasq
configuration file.

Note that is a Mitaka only patch. The properties were completely removed
in Newton in change I540ba5dc69d0506f71b59746efcce94c73f9317f.

Closes-Bug: 1590100
Closes-Bug: 1590101

Change-Id: I6d12a2b741b4a81bf60f47fd553b7f71cd25b1c1

commit_message:
Add extra DHCP routes

Previously DHCP extra routes (subnet host_routes) were not
implemented by networking_calico. Now we will populate the host
routes in etcd and implement them in the Calico DHCP agent.

Closes-Bug: #1602313
Change-Id: Iafaadef7bb6f740d3018b6107f3c9990ca02e16b

subject: Support for multi-class yamls in client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 10:25:58.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/common/utils.py', 'muranoclient/v1/artifact_packages.py', 'releasenotes/notes/multi-class-yamls-support-914b3d155324214f.yaml'], 'message': 'Support for multi-class yamls in client

MuranoClient needs to analyse package classes (names and inheritance
chains) to properly add packages to Glare. This requires it to
properly resolve class names in the appropriate namespaces.

Since Mitaka Murano supports multi-class yamls, i.e. yaml files
containing multiple MuranoPL classes in a single yaml file using it
multi-document format. Optionally this allows to reuse a single
namespace definition for multiple classes defined in the same file.

Client was not aware of this feature, always loading classes as
single-document yamls. It was also always using the current-class
namespace definitions, thus likely to fail if the shared namespace
definition is in use.

This has been addressed.

Closes-bug: #1608440
Change-Id: Ibd08454f71e0266c76a2ac517b441df97311d8b9
(cherry picked from commit 98adda6a46fd5d2032077758de1d72cefe4ef55c)
'}]
commit_message:
Support for multi-class yamls in client

MuranoClient needs to analyse package classes (names and inheritance
chains) to properly add packages to Glare. This requires it to
properly resolve class names in the appropriate namespaces.

Since Mitaka Murano supports multi-class yamls, i.e. yaml files
containing multiple MuranoPL classes in a single yaml file using it
multi-document format. Optionally this allows to reuse a single
namespace definition for multiple classes defined in the same file.

Client was not aware of this feature, always loading classes as
single-document yamls. It was also always using the current-class
namespace definitions, thus likely to fail if the shared namespace
definition is in use.

This has been addressed.

Closes-bug: #1608440
Change-Id: Ibd08454f71e0266c76a2ac517b441df97311d8b9
(cherry picked from commit 98adda6a46fd5d2032077758de1d72cefe4ef55c)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-05 09:13:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/objects/numa.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_numa.py'], 'message': 'Added better error messages during (un)pinning CPUs

Error messages during pinning and unpinning are same.
It's a confusing especially during migration for example.
You got message like "Cannot pin/unpin cpus [17] from the
following pinned set [3]" and you can't understand is it
a problem with removing a VM from old compute node
or with booting a VM on new compute node.

We should split these two cases.

Change-Id: Ic70ecdfa414fd8558d453fbf1c21640c8acc3ea1
'}]
commit_message:
Added better error messages during (un)pinning CPUs

Error messages during pinning and unpinning are same.
It's a confusing especially during migration for example.
You got message like "Cannot pin/unpin cpus [17] from the
following pinned set [3]" and you can't understand is it
a problem with removing a VM from old compute node
or with booting a VM on new compute node.

We should split these two cases.

Change-Id: Ic70ecdfa414fd8558d453fbf1c21640c8acc3ea1

subject: Create 'devref' folder and move version specs to it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-26 21:26:17.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/api-microversions.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'specs/devref/new-ironic-state-machine.rst', 'specs/devref/api-microversions.rst', 'specs/kilo/new-ironic-state-machine.rst'], 'message': "Create 'devref' folder and move version specs to it

Create a specs/devref folder for ongoing reference material.

Move the api-microversions and new-ironic-state-machine specs into this
new folder, while leaving breadcrumbs from the current document
locations.

Since neither spec was actually completed in Kilo, there is no benefit
to keeping these versions of the specs in tree as we iterate and refine
the design. This paves the way for these files to be updated without
needing to whole-sale copy the (incomplete) spec to a new
release-specific folder.

Change-Id: Ibfa8e34c22e9b2706a237c930063cce2c5c27a1c
"}]
commit_message:
Create 'devref' folder and move version specs to it

Create a specs/devref folder for ongoing reference material.

Move the api-microversions and new-ironic-state-machine specs into this
new folder, while leaving breadcrumbs from the current document
locations.

Since neither spec was actually completed in Kilo, there is no benefit
to keeping these versions of the specs in tree as we iterate and refine
the design. This paves the way for these files to be updated without
needing to whole-sale copy the (incomplete) spec to a new
release-specific folder.

Change-Id: Ibfa8e34c22e9b2706a237c930063cce2c5c27a1c

commit_message:
Introduce a "living" document for the state machine

This change reverts the kilo-implemented/new-ironic-state-machine spec
back to the contents it had when Kilo was released, while preserving
all changes since then in the new file, state-machine-ref.

Additionally, it updates some sections based on lessons we learned
during Kilo and Liberty, and adds description of API compatibility
requirements around adding new states as an aspiration for work in
Mitaka.

Change-Id: I2a74e590212684325d5a672ef28813578c975184

WinPE is a small operating system used to install, deploy, and
repair Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 R2, and other Windows
operating systems.

Many users are used to managing their machines by using WinPE.
They have many tools work well in the WinPE system which

commit_message:
Add `memdisk_boot` and support boot Windows PreInstallation
Environment（WinPE)

WinPE is a small operating system used to install, deploy, and
repair Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 R2, and other Windows
operating systems.

Many users are used to managing their machines by using WinPE.
They have many tools work well in the WinPE system which
make life easier. So why not provide the functionality in Ironic?

Change-Id: I17bb9f3e5c865f4eec2fc5339cd1b9134edcb4e7

subject: Add service managment API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-05 10:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/services-api.rst'], 'message': "Add service managment API

Proper operation depends on up-to-date information about the
availability of the services running. In environment with more
then one conductor, it's useful to have such information.
Currently there are no quick way to get all Ironic's services
and their status, also it would be  to have enable/disable
service feature for maintenance purposes. So this spec proposes
to add new API for this.

Change-Id: I9262829c800321e2fdd74ac965df133a91e6cb73
"}]
commit_message:
Add service managment API

Proper operation depends on up-to-date information about the
availability of the services running. In environment with more
then one conductor, it's useful to have such information.
Currently there are no quick way to get all Ironic's services
and their status, also it would be  to have enable/disable
service feature for maintenance purposes. So this spec proposes
to add new API for this.

Change-Id: I9262829c800321e2fdd74ac965df133a91e6cb73

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-10-26 08:52:32.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/virtualmedia-drivers-dhcpless-deploy.rst'], 'message': 'Virtual media drivers to deploy without DHCP

Currently virtual media drivers (iscsi_ilo, agent_ilo,
iscsi_irmc, agent_irmc) drivers use virtual media to boot
the deploy kernel/ramdisk.  The booted kernel/ramdisk fetches
the IP through dhcp. But these drivers can pass the IP details
to deploy kernel/ramdisk via virtual media and do the
provisioning without a dhcp server on the provisioning network.

Change-Id: Ib38751f9d040bd3eaffafbda077fa79bf1c78986
'}]
commit_message:
Virtual media drivers to deploy without DHCP

Currently virtual media drivers (iscsi_ilo, agent_ilo,
iscsi_irmc, agent_irmc) drivers use virtual media to boot
the deploy kernel/ramdisk.  The booted kernel/ramdisk fetches
the IP through dhcp. But these drivers can pass the IP details
to deploy kernel/ramdisk via virtual media and do the
provisioning without a dhcp server on the provisioning network.

Change-Id: Ib38751f9d040bd3eaffafbda077fa79bf1c78986

subject: Don't immediately null host/node when shelving
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 10:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't immediately null host/node when shelving

When offloading a shelved instance, resources should be freed. However,
the ability to free resources is dependant on being able to find the
resource tracker for an instance's node. At present, the instance node
and host are nulled before attempting to update the resource tracker,
meaning the resources are never actually freed. Fix this by nullifying
these values *after* resources updates.

Change-Id: I8f91367aacca0c7c673b28b3c844c70c0d12f0a5
Related-bug: #1545675
(cherry picked from commit 59f55a14b5f5396e653d9eb1e5ded31db72f620b)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't immediately null host/node when shelving

When offloading a shelved instance, resources should be freed. However,
the ability to free resources is dependant on being able to find the
resource tracker for an instance's node. At present, the instance node
and host are nulled before attempting to update the resource tracker,
meaning the resources are never actually freed. Fix this by nullifying
these values *after* resources updates.

Change-Id: I8f91367aacca0c7c673b28b3c844c70c0d12f0a5
Related-bug: #1545675
(cherry picked from commit 59f55a14b5f5396e653d9eb1e5ded31db72f620b)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 10380, 'name': 'Josh Gachnang', 'email': 'josh@pcsforeducation.com', 'username': 'JoshNang'}, {'_account_id': 11076, 'name': 'Shivanand Tendulker', 'email': 'stendulker@gmail.com', 'username': 'stendulker'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14810, 'name': 'Kan', 'email': 'sofaopenstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-11 09:17:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/lazy-delete-instances.rst'], 'message': "Deleting instances at any stage of the deployment

Nova expects to be able to delete an instance even when it's spawning
but in Ironic only nodes in DEPLOYWAIT state are allowed to be aborted
mid-deployment. This blueprint adds support for deleting an instance
at any stage of the deployment meeting nova's expectations.

Change-Id: Id53002e2e73289b1682f496ebf694d897b714f25
"}]
commit_message:
Deleting instances at any stage of the deployment

Nova expects to be able to delete an instance even when it's spawning
but in Ironic only nodes in DEPLOYWAIT state are allowed to be aborted
mid-deployment. This blueprint adds support for deleting an instance
at any stage of the deployment meeting nova's expectations.

Change-Id: Id53002e2e73289b1682f496ebf694d897b714f25

commit_message:
Indicate the deploy progress

Show the progress of the deployment, to give user more information
especially for long-time operation. This will also helpful to analysis
if something wrong in the deploy process.

Change-Id: I1a13bd27378b4335becdd2c3283ff6e0c1384725

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2015-12-17 11:51:36.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/console-log.rst'], 'message': 'Add console log support

This design spec introduces the console log support in Ironic.
It specifies how to log the console and retrieve the console
log output. It includes adding new functions in the common
driver interface, adding new REST API to get console log
as well as implementing the rpc topic for console to select
the original conductor.

Related-bug: #1526368

Change-Id: I579d1572b55c894da4af73ad3ff48a2dfa0de4a7
'}]
commit_message:
Add console log support

This design spec introduces the console log support in Ironic.
It specifies how to log the console and retrieve the console
log output. It includes adding new functions in the common
driver interface, adding new REST API to get console log
as well as implementing the rpc topic for console to select
the original conductor.

Related-bug: #1526368

Change-Id: I579d1572b55c894da4af73ad3ff48a2dfa0de4a7

subject: Evaluate 'task_state' in resource (de)allocation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 10:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Evaluate 'task_state' in resource (de)allocation

There are two types of VM states associated with shelving. The first,
'shelved' indicates that the VM has been powered off but the resources
remain allocated on the hypervisor. The second, 'shelved_offloaded',
indicates that the VM has been powered off and the resources freed.
When "unshelving" VMs in the latter state, the VM state does not change
from 'shelved_offloaded' until some time after the VM has been
"unshelved".

Change I83a5f06 introduced a change that allowed for deallocation of
resources when they were set to the 'shelved_offloaded' state. However,
the resource (de)allocation code path assumes any VM with a state of
'shelved_offloaded' should have resources deallocated from it, rather
than allocated to it. As the VM state has not changed when this code
path is executed, resources are incorrectly deallocated from the
instance twice.

Enhance the aformentioned check to account for task state in addition to
VM state. This ensures a VM that's still in 'shelved_offloaded' state,
but is in fact being unshelved, does not trigger deallocation.

Change-Id: Ie2e7b91937fc3d61bb1197fffc3549bebc65e8aa
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>
Resolves-bug: #1587386
Related-bug: #1545675
(cherry picked from commit f1320a7c2debf127a93773046adffb80563fd20b)
'}]
commit_message:
Evaluate 'task_state' in resource (de)allocation

There are two types of VM states associated with shelving. The first,
'shelved' indicates that the VM has been powered off but the resources
remain allocated on the hypervisor. The second, 'shelved_offloaded',
indicates that the VM has been powered off and the resources freed.
When "unshelving" VMs in the latter state, the VM state does not change
from 'shelved_offloaded' until some time after the VM has been
"unshelved".

Change I83a5f06 introduced a change that allowed for deallocation of
resources when they were set to the 'shelved_offloaded' state. However,
the resource (de)allocation code path assumes any VM with a state of
'shelved_offloaded' should have resources deallocated from it, rather
than allocated to it. As the VM state has not changed when this code
path is executed, resources are incorrectly deallocated from the
instance twice.

Enhance the aformentioned check to account for task state in addition to
VM state. This ensures a VM that's still in 'shelved_offloaded' state,
but is in fact being unshelved, does not trigger deallocation.

Change-Id: Ie2e7b91937fc3d61bb1197fffc3549bebc65e8aa
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>
Resolves-bug: #1587386
Related-bug: #1545675
(cherry picked from commit f1320a7c2debf127a93773046adffb80563fd20b)

commit_message:
RBAC settings for murano-dashboard

This patch add the RBAC settings for murano-dashboard,
Enable this:
1.copy muranodashboard/local/local_settings.d/_50_murano.py to
horizon openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d
2.copy the muranodashboard/conf/murano_policy.json to
horizon openstack_dashboard/conf dir

Partially-Implements: blueprint murano-dashboard-rbac
Change-Id: I3e6aec8e1cbe57cb80e6d1b8df012f5047aad511
Depends-On: I057ca57ba733022598fb188b1f372024392ddd3b

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-04 15:58:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_snapshot_manage.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/test_volume_manage.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_manage.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Fail manage operations if service is down

Existing code will fail at API level if a service is disabled and we try
to manage/get_manageable volumes/snapshots on that service, but it won't
fail at API level if the service is down, and the message will wait in
the message queue until the service is up again, which is misleading.

This patch changes this behavior and makes manage_existing,
manage_existing_snapshot, get_manageable_volumes, and
get_manageable_snapshots, fail at the API if the service is down.

Change-Id: Ifd56a46fce9ac2fe72a30820c05a5cf9adee229f
Closes-Bug: #1605109
"}]
commit_message:
Fail manage operations if service is down

Existing code will fail at API level if a service is disabled and we try
to manage/get_manageable volumes/snapshots on that service, but it won't
fail at API level if the service is down, and the message will wait in
the message queue until the service is up again, which is misleading.

This patch changes this behavior and makes manage_existing,
manage_existing_snapshot, get_manageable_volumes, and
get_manageable_snapshots, fail at the API if the service is down.

Change-Id: Ifd56a46fce9ac2fe72a30820c05a5cf9adee229f
Closes-Bug: #1605109

commit_message:
Update role SHA's to pull in upper-constraints fix

This patch updates the role SHA's to ensure that the upper-constraints
fixes are included in the next release.

It also includes an update to the lxc_hosts role to change the default
apt sources used due to issues with the Rackspace mirror.

subject: Fix external lock tests on Windows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 16:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/tests/unit/test_lockutils.py'], 'message': "Fix external lock tests on Windows

At the moment, those tests use fcntl to acquire file locks, which
will fail on Windows.

This change addresses this issue by adding some platform checks,
using the appropriate functions when handling file locks. Note that
we've avoided running private methods from fasteners.

Also, we now avoid using os.fork, which won't work on Windows.
Instead, we spawn new processes using multiprocessing.Process, using
queues for communication between processes.

Change-Id: I237fb53c17879b77dc9fc278f7e7a408f84985fb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix external lock tests on Windows

At the moment, those tests use fcntl to acquire file locks, which
will fail on Windows.

This change addresses this issue by adding some platform checks,
using the appropriate functions when handling file locks. Note that
we've avoided running private methods from fasteners.

Also, we now avoid using os.fork, which won't work on Windows.
Instead, we spawn new processes using multiprocessing.Process, using
queues for communication between processes.

Change-Id: I237fb53c17879b77dc9fc278f7e7a408f84985fb

commit_message:
Disable stderr logging

OSLO logging currently defaults the 'use_stderr' option to True
which results duplicate logs in service daemon logs for both
upstart and systemd. To correct this issue the use_stderr
option has been set to false.

Change-Id: I1974b9ad4080aa4253de9e3112f0973d44aa23f8
Closes-Bug: 1588051
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: change to 3600 point object size
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-08 12:52:16.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/storage/test_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py'], 'message': "change to 3600 point object size

currently we store 14400 points per object which equals roughly
128KB (max) object size. this is fine but all our default policies
do not come anywhere near 14400 points which means the split policy
doesn't offer much benefit.

this patch proposes change to 3600 points per object to encourage
more splits. it also benefits padding scenario to have less potential
for zero padding.

Change-Id: I0b243db4bd0882a4b5646fb56dc7c6c1c8fd788a
"}]
commit_message:
change to 3600 point object size

currently we store 14400 points per object which equals roughly
128KB (max) object size. this is fine but all our default policies
do not come anywhere near 14400 points which means the split policy
doesn't offer much benefit.

this patch proposes change to 3600 points per object to encourage
more splits. it also benefits padding scenario to have less potential
for zero padding.

Change-Id: I0b243db4bd0882a4b5646fb56dc7c6c1c8fd788a

commit_message:
Add API versioning to upload_to_image options

This patch adds start_versions to the visibility and
protected command line arguments in upload-to-image,
ensuring that they will only be used and appear in
help messages for API versions 3.1 or greater.

Change-Id: Ibda07b0471e45c7fbd4213682254bcdd41cd4353

commit_message:
Add failed auth attempts logic to meet PCI-DSS

This patch creates a new auth backend to track failed authentication
attempts and lock out suspicious accounts for configured duration
in order to support PCI-DSS limit repeated access attempts
requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.1.6: Limit repeated access attempts by locking out
the user ID after not more than six attempts.

Change-Id: I099a87f5691e1f8468c328e6c575021bd836f053
Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-08 01:49:25.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/prechecks/tasks/port_checks.yml'], 'message': 'Fix prechecks of a vip address

In the case of a single node environment without haproxy, the var
"kolla_internal_vip_adress" in global.yml should be the ip address
of the host. However, the prechecks will fail, because this ip
address is used by the host node and is pingable.

This commit fixes the prechecks of a vip address properly.
When the var "enable_haproxy" is "no", this fix will skip prechecks
for a vip address.

Change-Id: I0b752f179d20f82e3d6331047ee0bd802ab99a4b
Closes-Bug: #1570935
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prechecks of a vip address

In the case of a single node environment without haproxy, the var
"kolla_internal_vip_adress" in global.yml should be the ip address
of the host. However, the prechecks will fail, because this ip
address is used by the host node and is pingable.

This commit fixes the prechecks of a vip address properly.
When the var "enable_haproxy" is "no", this fix will skip prechecks
for a vip address.

Change-Id: I0b752f179d20f82e3d6331047ee0bd802ab99a4b
Closes-Bug: #1570935

commit_message:
Use assertIn, assertNotIn and assertIsNotNone

Instead of using assertTrue(A * B) / assertFalse(A * B)
developers should use assertNotIn, assertIn and assertIsNotNone.

Change-Id: I20eb9d15fda7aadb64dea6bf33960f64bec243b0

commit_message:
Revert "glance: disable swift backend"

This reverts commit b8c5ac736733e28315364a0c9e70465b6f41166d.

The changes to the swift-proxy pipeline [1] should potentially fix
the issue. So we should be able to use swift again as a backend.

[1] Ie4eeaaa83c4e0a181559af639fc13e7fc4939480
Change-Id: Ic587d9f018974f75dd2459bad1455b4affc0c80a

subject: Fix Alarm State Transitions tests to always work
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 14273, 'name': 'Joe Keen', 'email': 'joe.keen@hpe.com', 'username': 'jkeen'}, {'_account_id': 14517, 'name': 'Ryan Brandt', 'email': 'ryan.brandt@hpe.com', 'username': 'ryan-brandt'}, {'_account_id': 15027, 'name': 'Michael Hoppal', 'email': 'michael.jam.hoppal@hpe.com', 'username': 'michael-hoppal'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trębski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 18179, 'name': 'Kaiyan Sheng', 'email': 'kaiyan.sheng@hpe.com', 'username': 'kaiyan-sheng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 19:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarm_state_history_multiple_transitions.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarms_state_history_one_transition.py'], 'message': "Fix Alarm State Transitions tests to always work

We've been seeing random failures of these tests. It turns out to
a bug in influxdb where the sort of history by time does not work
correctly in the millisecond field.  2016-08-05T17:33:13.031Z is
sorted to be greater than 2016-08-05T17:33:13.303Z because it
must be not be formatting the leading zero. This is why the tests
randomly fail

So, make the timestamps at least a second apart to avoid the influxdb
bug

Change-Id: Ibddce6ff4ed4be6e1c54356f5b89a02439c21398
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Alarm State Transitions tests to always work

We've been seeing random failures of these tests. It turns out to
a bug in influxdb where the sort of history by time does not work
correctly in the millisecond field.  2016-08-05T17:33:13.031Z is
sorted to be greater than 2016-08-05T17:33:13.303Z because it
must be not be formatting the leading zero. This is why the tests
randomly fail

So, make the timestamps at least a second apart to avoid the influxdb
bug

Change-Id: Ibddce6ff4ed4be6e1c54356f5b89a02439c21398

subject: Refactor forking in container sync run_forever
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 17:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/sync.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py'], 'message': 'Refactor forking in container sync run_forever

By refactoring the creation of pipes and forking of child
processes into a helper method the test for run_forever
can be greatly simplified.

Also relocate when self.report() is called to get uniform
log events when one or more processes are used.

This patch also cleans up test_run_forever.

Change-Id: I6bbe195ee7757a62898d2c8551af7e9091afc3a0
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor forking in container sync run_forever

By refactoring the creation of pipes and forking of child
processes into a helper method the test for run_forever
can be greatly simplified.

Also relocate when self.report() is called to get uniform
log events when one or more processes are used.

This patch also cleans up test_run_forever.

Change-Id: I6bbe195ee7757a62898d2c8551af7e9091afc3a0

subject: Move container stats to a local variable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 17:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/sync.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py'], 'message': 'Move container stats to a local variable

container_stats does not need to be an instance variable.

Also container_stats is updated with the same entries as self.stats,
so use container_stats to gather the entries and update self.stats
in a single place. This allows for a child process to gather all stats
and update via a pipe, and removes need for child to be careful to reset
instance variable self.stats.

Change-Id: Iba06d5c06090b27e279a0de0f9074e429acd83dd
'}]
commit_message:
Move container stats to a local variable

container_stats does not need to be an instance variable.

Also container_stats is updated with the same entries as self.stats,
so use container_stats to gather the entries and update self.stats
in a single place. This allows for a child process to gather all stats
and update via a pipe, and removes need for child to be careful to reset
instance variable self.stats.

Change-Id: Iba06d5c06090b27e279a0de0f9074e429acd83dd

commit_message:
Correct the parameters's position of assertEqual

assertEqual using should be assertEqual(expected, actual)

misplace have two impacts:
1.giving confusing messages when some tests failed.
2.mislead other developer,new test modules may follow these wrong pattern

see Partial-Bug  https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.config/+bug/1604213

Change-Id: I4467d5efb1eed9f4c473c947c93afcfaf9be6ea6

Instance related exceptions like Instance in Invalidstate
need to be handled properly when adding or removing a
fixed ip to an instance.

Added check for instance state for those actions, only BUILDING
and ERROR state are not allowed because they might not have
instance.host field set to not be NONE.

Co-Authored-By: Anand Shanmugam <anand1712@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2ae70d9e6b24bda9bbec9656f22dfb24cd70b035
Closes-Bug: 1533260

commit_message:
Handle Instance Exceptions in add&remove fix ip

Instance related exceptions like Instance in Invalidstate
need to be handled properly when adding or removing a
fixed ip to an instance.

Added check for instance state for those actions, only BUILDING
and ERROR state are not allowed because they might not have
instance.host field set to not be NONE.

Co-Authored-By: Anand Shanmugam <anand1712@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2ae70d9e6b24bda9bbec9656f22dfb24cd70b035
Closes-Bug: 1533260

commit_message:
config options: improve help text of database (related) options (3/3)

This change provides a better help text for all api database related
config options. As some of them are given as-is to SQLAlchemy, I copied
the SQLAlchemy docs for them to provide a little more help to the ops.
As discussed on the ML, I drop the "services which consume this" section
we used to do on the previous patches:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095538.html

bp centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I0dc2fc1e5f4d2a9ed713c9295ea38dbac5b33684

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for stack profile

This patch fixes the unit tests for the heat stack profile. The original
unit test was using MagicMock() and it was not verifying the parameters
used in calls. This patch also contain some minor changes to the profile
implementation.

Change-Id: Ie13f5442c2abccbd4c74dd0c50cb280f3d2afe8b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-08 08:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/os/heat/stack.py', 'senlin/tests/drivers/openstack/heat_v1.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_heat_stack.py'], 'message': "Use SDK status wait when creating stacks

We are not supposed to 'invent' a lot of non-generic logics in any
profile type implementation. One example is about the status waiting.
This patch proposes to revise heat stack creation so that we use the
generic wait logic in SDK.

Change-Id: I6420df0ce962930fd04ea1bf174202f80046addd
"}]
commit_message:
Use SDK status wait when creating stacks

We are not supposed to 'invent' a lot of non-generic logics in any
profile type implementation. One example is about the status waiting.
This patch proposes to revise heat stack creation so that we use the
generic wait logic in SDK.

Change-Id: I6420df0ce962930fd04ea1bf174202f80046addd

commit_message:
Add wait_for_stack call to heat driver

This adds a 'wait_for_stack' call to the heat_v1 driver. This method can
be used to simplify the many wait logics in the heat stack profile.

Change-Id: I94df298dd264da412fd9bd9b31c0cd9d8d06c4b5

subject: quickstart was erroneously using OPT_WORKDIR
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 12:53:03.000000000', 'files': ['quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'quickstart was erroneously using OPT_WORKDIR

quickstart.sh was erroneously reading files from `OPT_WORKDIR` that it
should be reading from `OOOQ_DIR`.  In particular, when running with
`--no-clone`, quickstart.sh would read configuration files from
`OPT_WORKDIR`, which was surprising behavior when trying to test out
local changes to those files.

This patch also ensure that `OOOQ_DIR` is a fully qualified path,
rather than `.`.

Change-Id: I0341877ba204b6a9cebdcf767572750369ee4d8b
'}]
commit_message:
quickstart was erroneously using OPT_WORKDIR

quickstart.sh was erroneously reading files from `OPT_WORKDIR` that it
should be reading from `OOOQ_DIR`.  In particular, when running with
`--no-clone`, quickstart.sh would read configuration files from
`OPT_WORKDIR`, which was surprising behavior when trying to test out
local changes to those files.

This patch also ensure that `OOOQ_DIR` is a fully qualified path,
rather than `.`.

Change-Id: I0341877ba204b6a9cebdcf767572750369ee4d8b

commit_message:
Use 'six' instead of oslo_utils.strutils.six

'six' is an independent third party module so it doesn't
need to be imported and used from oslo_utils.strutils.

TrivialFix

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-01 15:02:19.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/generic-resource-pools.rst'], 'message': 'Amend placement REST API with allocation records

Not sure how or why we forgot to include an ability for a caller to set
and delete allocation records against resource providers, but we did.

This amendment to the spec adds two additional REST API calls for
setting and deleting allocation records in an atomic fashion (atomic
operation for a set of resources consumed by a single consumer against
one or more resource providers). These REST API calls will be made from
the Nova resource tracker when instances claim or free resources on the
compute nodes.

The endpoint is /allocations/{consumer_uuid} accepting PUT and DELETE
methods.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: I5ef70ae2e13b1dd0c0ef1fa5821b3ee5a3265ca7
Blueprint: generic-resource-pools
'}]
commit_message:
Amend placement REST API with allocation records

Not sure how or why we forgot to include an ability for a caller to set
and delete allocation records against resource providers, but we did.

This amendment to the spec adds two additional REST API calls for
setting and deleting allocation records in an atomic fashion (atomic
operation for a set of resources consumed by a single consumer against
one or more resource providers). These REST API calls will be made from
the Nova resource tracker when instances claim or free resources on the
compute nodes.

The endpoint is /allocations/{consumer_uuid} accepting PUT and DELETE
methods.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: I5ef70ae2e13b1dd0c0ef1fa5821b3ee5a3265ca7
Blueprint: generic-resource-pools

subject: Disable stderr logging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-04 17:44:54.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova.conf.j2'], 'message': "Disable stderr logging

OSLO logging currently defaults the 'use_stderr' option to True
which results duplicate logs in service daemon logs for both
upstart and systemd. To correct this issue the use_stderr
option has been set to false.

Change-Id: I1974b9ad4080aa4253de9e3112f0973d44aa23f8
Closes-Bug: 1588051
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Disable stderr logging

OSLO logging currently defaults the 'use_stderr' option to True
which results duplicate logs in service daemon logs for both
upstart and systemd. To correct this issue the use_stderr
option has been set to false.

Change-Id: I1974b9ad4080aa4253de9e3112f0973d44aa23f8
Closes-Bug: 1588051
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Support retype in K2 cinder driver

Add retype feature for Kaminario K2 iSCSI and FC cinder drivers.

Use deprecation mechanism for option 'kaminario_nodedup_substring'.
Use get on connector dict for 'host' and 'wwpns'.
Implements: blueprint k2-retype
Co-Authored-By: Sreedhar Varma<Sreedhar.Varma.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lakshman<Lakshmi.Narayana.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: VenkataKrishna Reddy <Venkata.Krishna.ctr@kaminario.com>

Change-Id: I5cf20742e2ec8c1f785f3d6352de11e9198908a1

subject: Neutron-network services split out into discrete pods
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 20:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['services/neutron/neutron-dhcp-agent-pod.yml.j2', 'services/neutron/neutron-metadata-agent-pod.yml.j2', 'services/neutron/neutron-l3-agent-pod.yml.j2', 'services/neutron/neutron-network-pod.yml.j2', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml'], 'message': "Neutron-network services split out into discrete pods

All three of the services in the former neutron-network pod
will now start up correctly.

* Still bare pods; that's a separate task to turn them into
  PetSets and/or RC's.
* Configmap fixed with underscores
* Avoiding weird issues caused by three different configmaps
  trying to mount at the same path.

Change-Id: I66a66f281bd180c09348c537ccc81c494c8e96fd
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-kubernetes
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron-network services split out into discrete pods

All three of the services in the former neutron-network pod
will now start up correctly.

* Still bare pods; that's a separate task to turn them into
  PetSets and/or RC's.
* Configmap fixed with underscores
* Avoiding weird issues caused by three different configmaps
  trying to mount at the same path.

Change-Id: I66a66f281bd180c09348c537ccc81c494c8e96fd
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-kubernetes
