[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-04 17:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/yaql_integration.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/CreatingClass.yaml', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_construction.py', 'murano/dsl/object_store.py'], 'message': 'Move .init call into separate load phase

Before this commit .init method were called as the last step
of second phase initialization. This is also the phase when
forward references are get resolved.

Because load phases work recursively second phase of load
for the nested objects will happen before the outer counterparts.
If those nested objects were to access their owners in the .init
method it can cause exception to be thrown because forward
reference of the owner were not yet resolved.

This commits moves .init calls out of the second phase. Now
during the second phase we collect everything that need to
be called and call it after the complete graph load.
This also guarantees that we call .init only on the object graph
that can be loaded (since it already loaded by that time)

Change-Id: Ie86655bcc668be880a7b97695835ccddb9adda0f
'}]
commit_message:
Move .init call into separate load phase

Before this commit .init method were called as the last step
of second phase initialization. This is also the phase when
forward references are get resolved.

Because load phases work recursively second phase of load
for the nested objects will happen before the outer counterparts.
If those nested objects were to access their owners in the .init
method it can cause exception to be thrown because forward
reference of the owner were not yet resolved.

This commits moves .init calls out of the second phase. Now
during the second phase we collect everything that need to
be called and call it after the complete graph load.
This also guarantees that we call .init only on the object graph
that can be loaded (since it already loaded by that time)

Change-Id: Ie86655bcc668be880a7b97695835ccddb9adda0f

subject: Get rid of type origins
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}, {'_account_id': 20364, 'name': 'Konstantin Snihyr', 'email': 'konstantin.lex@gmail.com', 'username': 'ksnihyr'}, {'_account_id': 20563, 'name': 'Omar Shykhkerimov', 'email': 'omar.shikhkerimov@gmail.com', 'username': 'oshykhkerimov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-04 17:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/meta.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_type.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_functions.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of type origins

Due to how versioning works, when class inheritance
graph for particular class might be changed so that
there won't be several versions of the same class along
different inheritance paths if they all can be merged into
a single class without breaking the requirements.
This means that parent of some base class might be different
from those that would be if that base class would created alone.

Before this commit there was a class remapping table that
was saying which parent class should be replaced with which
in the inheritance graph (considering that both classes differ
in version only). Each class used to have such table. Thus in
oder to do the graph traversal type origin (root of that graph)
need to be known in order to obtain remappings table.

However in certain cases information on type origin got lost.
For example if one would do cast($obj, Parent).method()
the method would be looked up in the Parent class and all
in ancestors like if the Parent was the type origin. This could
cause different resolution from what would happen if the lookup
algorithm new that the true type origin is type($obj) instead.

This commit brings different solution to the original problem
eliminating the need to know type origin. Instead when the base
class parents need to be changed, because we cannot change
the class parents due to the fact that this change is only
relevant in context of origin type, we create a clone MuranoType
instance which differs in its parents ony.

The downside of this solution is that now there could be several
MuranoType instances representing the same type and attempt
to lookup the type in its package may return different object
from what you would get from type(cast($obj, Parent)). This is
solved by making them comparable (with == and !=). So now
instead of saying "obj.type is Type" one should use
"obj.type == Type" instead. Because there is no "is" comparision
in MuranoPL nothing breaks there from this change.

Another issue is that there are static properties which values
must be shared across all type clones. This is solved by making
a clone with copy.copy() shallow cloning function. Thus internal
dictionary where property values are stored remains the same
for all clones.

Closes-Bug: #1608712
Change-Id: Ib29f731f2598eaf7e7ea5f69f75e023d7155af5e
'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of type origins

Due to how versioning works, when class inheritance
graph for particular class might be changed so that
there won't be several versions of the same class along
different inheritance paths if they all can be merged into
a single class without breaking the requirements.
This means that parent of some base class might be different
from those that would be if that base class would created alone.

Before this commit there was a class remapping table that
was saying which parent class should be replaced with which
in the inheritance graph (considering that both classes differ
in version only). Each class used to have such table. Thus in
oder to do the graph traversal type origin (root of that graph)
need to be known in order to obtain remappings table.

However in certain cases information on type origin got lost.
For example if one would do cast($obj, Parent).method()
the method would be looked up in the Parent class and all
in ancestors like if the Parent was the type origin. This could
cause different resolution from what would happen if the lookup
algorithm new that the true type origin is type($obj) instead.

This commit brings different solution to the original problem
eliminating the need to know type origin. Instead when the base
class parents need to be changed, because we cannot change
the class parents due to the fact that this change is only
relevant in context of origin type, we create a clone MuranoType
instance which differs in its parents ony.

The downside of this solution is that now there could be several
MuranoType instances representing the same type and attempt
to lookup the type in its package may return different object
from what you would get from type(cast($obj, Parent)). This is
solved by making them comparable (with == and !=). So now
instead of saying "obj.type is Type" one should use
"obj.type == Type" instead. Because there is no "is" comparision
in MuranoPL nothing breaks there from this change.

Another issue is that there are static properties which values
must be shared across all type clones. This is solved by making
a clone with copy.copy() shallow cloning function. Thus internal
dictionary where property values are stored remains the same
for all clones.

Closes-Bug: #1608712
Change-Id: Ib29f731f2598eaf7e7ea5f69f75e023d7155af5e

commit_message:
fix table delete bug & collect table events

Bug occurs in using batch delete more than one time in one page.
Deleted items haven't been removed from selections after batch delete action.

I fix this with broadcasting a clear action in hz-resource-table.

Change-Id: I8ac0cc2c8964aec321feb7cf0f45463d15f139ff
Closes-Bug: #1605083

commit_message:
Add unique keys for non locking model

The unique key colums are part of the new non locking model.
The migration scripts adds 2 unique key columns to 2 tables.

One of the new columns is already in the model and the other is
under review.

Change-Id: Icd352ed709f378a8141bcf6264bc9abba0f8db9a
Closes-Bug: #1610269

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-05 22:51:20.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/cinder-api.yaml'], 'message': "Update cinder-api with new authtoken parameters

Puppet OpenStack modules are moving to a new class to configure Keystone
authtoken parameters, so we can more easily enable Keystone v3 from a
single interface. It's consistent across all modules and does support
both Keystone v2 and v3 parameters.

This patch updates Cinder now, but more will follow when we'll add
support to all modules.

Change-Id: I5aa3f2b03672c14c0dbeac222f421ab94221ecf7
"}]
commit_message:
Update cinder-api with new authtoken parameters

Puppet OpenStack modules are moving to a new class to configure Keystone
authtoken parameters, so we can more easily enable Keystone v3 from a
single interface. It's consistent across all modules and does support
both Keystone v2 and v3 parameters.

This patch updates Cinder now, but more will follow when we'll add
support to all modules.

Change-Id: I5aa3f2b03672c14c0dbeac222f421ab94221ecf7

commit_message:
Modify API to include cluster related operations

This patch adds new API /cluster that allows summary and detailed
listings, show and update operations.

It also updates service listings to return cluster_name for each
service.

DocImpact: 3 new policies have been added for cluster, "get", "get_all" and
           "update".
APIImpact: Return cluster_name in service listings and add /cluster endpoint.
Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: If1ef3a80900ca6d117bf854ad3de142d93694adf

commit_message:
Glance tasks lost configuration item conversion_format

Glance convert task will use configuration item conversion_format.
But the configuration item cann't be auto-generated. So this patch
fix it.

Change-Id: I6a5d2f6d2de68d7643e7b36e82f7fdd14546a82b
Closes-Bug: #1533949

subject: Switch to tripleo-centos-7 for tripleo-ci jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-07 14:08:28.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch to tripleo-centos-7 for tripleo-ci jobs

This is a cosmetic change for nodepool, since this image still only
runs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1, we need the prefix still.

We do this over a series of commits not to affect running jobs.

Change-Id: I12314b577ec78df6ec67948ffca76c3f3b020e08
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to tripleo-centos-7 for tripleo-ci jobs

This is a cosmetic change for nodepool, since this image still only
runs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1, we need the prefix still.

We do this over a series of commits not to affect running jobs.

Change-Id: I12314b577ec78df6ec67948ffca76c3f3b020e08
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

In Mitaka the undercloud Glance images were store in 'swift'
backend, disabled by I5e2feff7e5dc900849c9535f2b7ac05d3c8f93e1.

This change configures both the 'file' and 'swift' backends for

commit_message:
Allow usage of both 'file' and 'swift' Glance backends

In Mitaka the undercloud Glance images were store in 'swift'
backend, disabled by I5e2feff7e5dc900849c9535f2b7ac05d3c8f93e1.

This change configures both the 'file' and 'swift' backends for
Glance but defaults to 'file'.

Closes-Bug: 1610935
Change-Id: I167208c061890d171475152dae13c359e0e2ed57

subject: Add a .gitreview file and ssh to build
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-08 12:14:41.000000000', 'files': ['bb', '.gitreview', 'check-and-build-bpo'], 'message': "Add a .gitreview file and ssh to build

1/ Add a .gitreview to push on the correct branch.
2/ Use ssh localhost to use sbuild, as otherwise, sbuild groups
aren't setup correctly.
3/ Do not attempt to rewrite the dget URL (leave whatever is in
packages.debian.org) for the moment.
4/ Fix the deletion of .build files
5/ Allow copy of .orig file to fail (in case it's a native package
and the file doesn't exist).

Change-Id: I80dadc0d798a1a7033e7169d6d2a2362040c518b
"}]
commit_message:
Add a .gitreview file and ssh to build

1/ Add a .gitreview to push on the correct branch.
2/ Use ssh localhost to use sbuild, as otherwise, sbuild groups
aren't setup correctly.
3/ Do not attempt to rewrite the dget URL (leave whatever is in
packages.debian.org) for the moment.
4/ Fix the deletion of .build files
5/ Allow copy of .orig file to fail (in case it's a native package
and the file doesn't exist).

Change-Id: I80dadc0d798a1a7033e7169d6d2a2362040c518b

The oslo.config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

commit_message:
Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo.config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.
Note: PorOpt allows port 0, which tells the OS to automatically
assign a port. We also assign port with 0 unit test.

Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: I90008e7b49ce753eb0fcc1a4cdef5f1b9a69641f

Following the doc in install-guide, some code is out of date.

endpoints.
Second, add xinetd package in install requirements.

commit_message:
Fix the mistakes in Installation Guide doc

Following the doc in install-guide, some code is out of date.
First, according to http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/install-guide-rdo/,
maybe, it`s better to using v3 commands replace the olds in creating
endpoints.
Second, add xinetd package in install requirements.

Closes-bug: #1608916
Signed-off-by: zhangjl <zhangjl@awcloud.com>

Change-Id: I5bb448479156dbc805c7ecae00d2f694850b24c0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 17:25:58.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.yaml', 'puppet/all-nodes-config.yaml'], 'message': 'Convert AllNodesConfig hosts config to a map

Currently we have hard-coded parameters for each role, but to enable
custom roles, we need to pass a generic hosts list that can be joined
for all enabled roles.

Change-Id: I0606f462ff61c3a541342b63fee7d46ebfd1f4e0
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
'}]
commit_message:
Convert AllNodesConfig hosts config to a map

Currently we have hard-coded parameters for each role, but to enable
custom roles, we need to pass a generic hosts list that can be joined
for all enabled roles.

Change-Id: I0606f462ff61c3a541342b63fee7d46ebfd1f4e0
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

This is essentially the same data as defined in the *Services parameter,
but it shows what's enabled for all roles in the format output from the

like conditional endpoint generation in future.

Change-Id: Ia4b1694e419533b05d2757d2925471cae75fb5b6

commit_message:
Add EnabledServices output to overcloud.yaml

This is essentially the same data as defined in the *Services parameter,
but it shows what's enabled for all roles in the format output from the
service templates, so is useful for debugging, and possibly for things
like conditional endpoint generation in future.

Change-Id: Ia4b1694e419533b05d2757d2925471cae75fb5b6

commit_message:
Removes MANIFEST.in as it is not needed explicitely by PBR

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a sensible
manifest from git files and some standard files and it removes
the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Iddbd1a4b574223d840707351c5e8f025d56f2046

subject: Use sys.exit for main
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 02:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Use sys.exit for main

Now the sys.exit() calls are annoying: when main() calls sys.exit()
, your interactive Python interpreter will exit! The remedy is to
let main()'s return value specify the exit status.

more information:http://www.artima.com/weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=4829

Change-Id: Iccb12b394ed7e5da9d38c23a97b61541aa7f7aaa
"}]
commit_message:
Use sys.exit for main

Now the sys.exit() calls are annoying: when main() calls sys.exit()
, your interactive Python interpreter will exit! The remedy is to
let main()'s return value specify the exit status.

more information:http://www.artima.com/weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=4829

Change-Id: Iccb12b394ed7e5da9d38c23a97b61541aa7f7aaa

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318840/ decomposed the Sahara services
but they weren't added to the ControllerServices list, thus are now disabled.

Since we shipped mitaka with sahara enabled by default, we should probably add
them so the behavior is consistent when folks upgrade.

This also fixes a couple of issues we missed when landing the initial service
templates (partly because CI didn't test them).

In order for each service to operate independently when used with Pacemaker,
the roles needed to be separated. This commit also does this.

Depends-On: Id61eb15b1e2366f5b73c6e7d47941651e40651b1
Change-Id: I0846b328e9d938275e373d58f0b99219b19b326c
Closes-Bug: #1592284
Co-Authored-By: Brad P. Crochet <brad@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add Sahara services to ControllerServices list

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318840/ decomposed the Sahara services
but they weren't added to the ControllerServices list, thus are now disabled.

Since we shipped mitaka with sahara enabled by default, we should probably add
them so the behavior is consistent when folks upgrade.

This also fixes a couple of issues we missed when landing the initial service
templates (partly because CI didn't test them).

In order for each service to operate independently when used with Pacemaker,
the roles needed to be separated. This commit also does this.

Depends-On: Id61eb15b1e2366f5b73c6e7d47941651e40651b1
Change-Id: I0846b328e9d938275e373d58f0b99219b19b326c
Closes-Bug: #1592284
Co-Authored-By: Brad P. Crochet <brad@redhat.com>

Fix misc issues with unit tests

Neutron core restructured configuration options into neutron.conf;
update imports in unit test cases appropriately.

Add 'find' to the whitelist of external commands.

Change-Id: Id48dc7190d7943929c774d42e740f0739ddcc0ca

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience
py35 venv.

Change-Id: Iff604064b5989a5a9e07163447d6c34f32e91919

commit_message:
Fix software config api-ref doc

This patch adds the missing list operation on software configs. It also
reorders the operations on configs/deployments so that finding API docs
will be a little bit easier.

Change-Id: I26e4b34000b71c61f9d9de327c7754ff9031d6b4

subject: Don't create an "update task" inside a try block
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-08 08:31:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Don't create an "update task" inside a try block

The code inside the "except" block depends on the update_task variable
that may not have been successfully assigned in the "try" block.  Move
that code out of the "try" block so the exception can bubble up
instead of being obscured by a "local variable 'update_task'
referenced before assignment" error.

Change-Id: I88d6f13ee4365b1327ffc06c961600262396e066
Closes-Bug: #1561066
(cherry picked from commit 4446b861f4b8f81ef4b41310b81b5a06a33b946a)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't create an "update task" inside a try block

The code inside the "except" block depends on the update_task variable
that may not have been successfully assigned in the "try" block.  Move
that code out of the "try" block so the exception can bubble up
instead of being obscured by a "local variable 'update_task'
referenced before assignment" error.

Change-Id: I88d6f13ee4365b1327ffc06c961600262396e066
Closes-Bug: #1561066
(cherry picked from commit 4446b861f4b8f81ef4b41310b81b5a06a33b946a)

commit_message:
Fix wrong step order in upgrade_smoke test group

We are trying to reinstall master node on not reverted env.
That's obviously wrong.

Change-Id: I24c2a4e36dbc1c1d42a364c25930a88e5da6af5f
